div.head: Editorial restoration: Word incompletely restored
div.p: gap (gap) indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible, invisible, or inaudible.
supplied signifies text supplied by the transcriber or editor for any reason, typically because the original cannot be read because of physical damage or loss to the original.
supplied indicates text lost from the original support, restored by the editor either by comparison with other texts or through other contextual knowledge.

Required attributes:
reason explains why the text has been restored, and for text restored in lacunae, is given the value "lost" (although other values are possible).

Optional attributes include:
cert indicates text that is uncertainly restored.
